result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J Olin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11/06/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample; pay the surcharge. Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civiljudgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Continue with current counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
- Parties cannot live together unless approved by the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment and/or school.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel J Olin in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Samuel J Olin in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Monica E.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days concurrent in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11/06/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Continue with current counselling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.  Parties cannot live together unless approved by the agent.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
-No firearms; weapons.
-DNA sample, pay the surcharge.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel J Olin in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discussion on the record with the parties.  Defendant has two cases before Branch 40, however only Case# 15CM002213 on today's calendar.
This case is scheduled for review hearing on 10-30-2015.

Defense counsel requests both cases be adjourned on the same date.  Court orders this case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.
Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Samuel J Olin in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Wiaver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  Filed, signed Domestic Violence Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  
The Court reviewed the Intake Requirement and Further Conditions with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended for a period of nine months.  Review hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel J Olin in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Letter documenting participation at the Dewey Center received and filed.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04/29/15
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Samuel J Olin
Current: 7700 N. Club Circle, Fox Point, WI 53217   (Effective: 05-01-2015)
Prior: 1129 North Jackson Street #1016, Milwaukee, WI 53202
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Arguments to the Court regarding amending the No Contact Order to a No VIOLENT Contact Order.  Court will amend No Contact Order.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Violent Contact Order.  Defendant to have no violent contact with Monica E.

No firearms
No dangerous weapons

Defendant Samuel J Olin in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-084

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court orders case adjourned for pre-trial conference in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 05-01-2015 at 01:30pm
